newsitem.title: ITALY: INSTANT VIEW-Italy Aug CPI seen at 3.3 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: INSTANT VIEW-Italy Aug CPI seen at 3.3 pct yr/yr.

text.p: Following are analysts' comments on preliminary Italian consumer prices data from six sample cities showing inflation is likely to be 3.3/3.4 percent year on year in August and 0.0/0.1 percent month on month.
The rates are analysts' estimates after the data. Forecasts had been for 3.6 percent year on year and 0.1 percent month on month.

Luciana Trevisan, economist at Caboto, said "In my opinion the Bank of Italy will cut interest rates at the end of the year because the target of three percent will be reached in November or December."
Sharda Persaud, European economist at San Paolo bank in London, said so far on the data released she forecast consumer prices at 3.3 percent year on year for August.
"It's very good data...We see inflation heading down possibly to 3.0 percent in October which would give enough room for Bank of Italy governor Antonio Fazio to cut rates again."
"We see the discount rate coming down to about 7.0 percent by the end of the year so we see two more cuts in the discount rate," Persaud said.

Riccardo Barbieri, Italian economist at Morgan Stanley in London said, "Yes, the numbers are pretty good. I was expecting an increase of 0.1 percent on the month, and since the increase is actually on average slightly below that level, I think the inflation rate will probably decline to at least 3.4 percent if not 3.3 percent at the national level from 3.6 percent in July".
A further four Italian sample cities report their preliminary August CPI data tomorrow, while ISTAT will publish the official August Italian CPI figures on September 5.
